sub_title:
Bringing safe, easy-to-use & cutting-edge innovation to clinical staff and patients
- Validation & Usability Lead
summary:
Working towards bringing disruptive innovation in healthcare, by acting as a bridge between development, business and clinical world, with passion and commitment.

As a professional, I strive to produce a daily impact with my work with a constant focus on improving patient’s quality of life. I am dedicated to reach meaningful goals, both for the company, for the clinicians and therefore to the benefit of patients.
 
 Thanks to analytic mindset combined with a pragmatic approach to problem solving, I am a key contributor in shaping new product and services propositions that start from a detailed analysis of clinical workflows and patient experiences.

treasury_media.title: Fiber Optic RealShape (FORS) Technology - Research | Philips
treasury_media.description: As Philips, we are committed to helping caregivers treat their patients better. Playing a central role in the transition from open to minimally-invasive interventions was already a great step forward in this. Now we want to further innovate the procedure.

awards.title: Award for Best Research Project during the Winter School in Robotic Surgery and Vision
awards.description:
Real time surface tracking and registration for needle insertion guidance in RF or microwave ablation.
Developed in collaboration with Bogdan Mihai Maris from the University of Verona (IT)
2-day project, pitched in Petcha-Kutcha style during the final day of the Winter School.

certifications.name: Design and Interpretation of Clinical Trials
5B Radiation Level Expertise - Working with Radioactivity

projects.title: Technology development and clinical application of hyperspectral imaging for the operating room
projects.description: Development of research prototype for proof-of-concept of the technology; Activities involved the design, execution and evaluation of results of a volunteer study to prove the feasibility of multi-spectral imaging in enhancing biologic features, discriminating tissue and. Landscaping of existing technologies in the world of hyperspectral imaging and evaluation of their application in the medical domain were part of the assignment, as well as frequent reporting to stakeholders, colleagues and higher management.

courses.name: Winter school Surgical robotics and Vision

profile_positions.description:
As Validation Lead of our innovative real-time 3D-guidance technology for endovascular treatments, I am responsible for:
- coordinating the definition of the validation strategy for new product releases
- defining, planning, executing and documenting (pre-clinical) validation, according to FDA “Design Controls”.
- Managing usability engineering studies including documentation, testing strategy, planning and participant recruitment according to IEC62366 and FDA guidance "Applying Human Factors and Usability Engineering to Medical Devices"
- defining relevant clinical and system user needs for new product releases, together with the Application Specialists, Clinical and Marketing team;
- Representing usability engineering in risk assessment (uFMEA, RMM) according to IEC14971 to define the impact of usability-related risks and measuring effectiveness of risk mitigations.
- creating and releasing official customer training material (with application specialists) and contributing to the creation of the product IFU.
- coordinating user-experience activities aimed at giving recommendations and setting directions for system design, based on insights from the product usage, considering application and user-specific needs.
profile_positions.title: Validation and Usability Lead

profile_positions.description:
As clinical and technology consultant for innovation project in Philips Design, I connected R&D, Clinical, Marketing across Research and Businesses to create innovations for healthcare, within the endovascular interventions.

As a clinical consultant, I applied my thorough understanding of the medical environment and my analytical knowledge of clinical workflows to ensure that customer-centric propositions are developed, thus ensuring that Philips innovations are improving physician's practice, and patients' outcomes.

Responsibilities: 
- Scoping projects: when clarifying goals, budget and resources is essential to guarantee executable and relevant involvement from Design side. 
- Execution: I ensure that relevant propositions take shape, by steering the creative process with clinical and medical insights, by making use of my analytical skills and lateral creative thinking, and by running workshops and multi-disciplinary teams activities. 
--> I made sure good communication with key stakeholders is maintained, by continuously aligning on expectations and project deliverable.
--> I executed user studies, interviewed physicians and visited multiple customers to map their needs and detailed clinical workflows (use of technology and techniques). I focused on Image-Guided Therapy procedures, in abdominal, neurovascular and Peripheral Vascular Diseases.
--> I became proficient in using Design Thinking methodologies, organizing and facilitating Co-Creation workshops with internal stakeholders in R&D, clinical science, marketing.
--> Leading the team, I have successfully setup and facilitated Design Sprints for rapid co-creation of Sw and HW prototypes
- Delivery: I made sure insights and recommendations are captured and ensure effective knowledge transfer to internal stakeholders
- Follow-up: I created long-lasting relationships with internal stakeholders
profile_positions.title: Design Strategist, Clinical consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Internal internship: Image-Guided Therapies, Marketing at Philips Healthcare, Best, The Netherlands (6 months)
Deep-dive into a software functionality of Philips’ Allura Clarity® system allowing navigation during cardiovascular interventions (neuro, abdominal, thoracic an peripheral), with focus on technical and clinical understanding as complementary to marketing (market penetration, usability, complaints). 
Goal: to make recommendations to improve the functionality in terms of usability and for possible new applications. Phase I: Collected inputs from application specialists, users, development team, marketing team, customer service. Phase II: propose improvements on usability, workflow, training, algorithms to target new applications.

Development of personal skills in various areas of Research:
- Setting-up experiments and measurements
- Team working and Planning of Research Activities

- Hyper-spectral imaging: topic owner, prototype development for proof of concept, organizing and managing a pilot human study for concept validation.  
- Techniques For Computer Vision and platforms for Image-guided therapies
- Data Mining: techniques for dimensionality reduction, data classification.

- Ultrasound therapy - applications
- Philips Sonalleve System for High Intensity Ultrasound Therapy
- Methods for Characterization of Ultrasound fields and Power measurements
- Device performances evaluation to ensure compliance to application requirements
profile_positions.title: Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Master's Thesis Project in Minimally Invasive Healthcare Department:
Development and validation of a simulation program for Magnetic Resonance-guided High Intensity Focused Ultrasounds (MRgHIFU) therapy for bone ablation therapy

volunteer_experiences.description: Azioni di supporto al mantenimento del centro e accoglienza visitatori al centro

NL Doet is a national volunteering day organized by OranjeFonds (http://www.nldoet.nl/) to promote participation in society by offering concrete supports social cohesion and social integration projects such as small-scale community initiatives, mentoring projects for young and poor people.
